text:
hey guys today I am at a Japanese restaurant 
and in Thailand Japanese food is big and I

find it to be a little different from Japanese 
restaurants in North America as well the food

tends to be a little higher and so they they 
tend to be expensive here and but they have

different offerings so let's see what we've 
got the first thing we've got is just basic

salmon sashimi and this is looks like really good 
quality if you can see how much fat there is in

that piece garnished with a little bit of flour 
and so what I think is really interesting with

this is they have pickled West sabi so wasabi 
is natural plantation right and so instead of

just giving you that paste which is often time 
made from a powder this is pickled wasabi root

and this one is scallops with slightly torched it 
looks like and then the little dollop on top is

meant by KO which is a kind of a fish roe so now 
I'm going to try the the scallop with mint Michael

and I'm gonna dip it oh it's a little 
bit burnt underneath so that's a torching

mmm melted in my mouth a little creamy from 
the rope and slight charred smokiness from that

torching that is really good this is definitely 
stuff I can't find in Canada but I know about

you maybe you can find something like this where 
you live let me know this is shrimp tempura and

I just wanted to point out how crispy that 
batter looks you don't always get to pour

a batter to look like that at any old sushi place 
and also a little bit of a deep fried shiso leaves

I believe so this is a seafood salad with lots 
of economic as salmon roe oh and there's other

kinds of row 2 so there's little ones as well and 
so tons of mayo there's avocado salmon imitation

crab and some veggies so I guess this is our 
healthy dish of this jam you could call it that

Wow there's a lot more vegetables than 
I thought a little bit of surf clam in

this salad as well so got this bite 
of veggies some Roe and the surf clam

pretty good a little too much Mayo for 
my liking but if you like Mayo especially

Japanese Mayo cuz that's what this is it's 
really quite good this is seared foie gras

sushi now there are only two pieces only my 
brother and my friend are gonna have it I'm

not a big fan of a big massive piece of 
coral like this so I'm going to skip it

a bunch of sushi just arrived so right here 
is blowtorch salmon with the miso sauce on

top and the miso has also been torched this 
is the tuna sashimi sorry tuna sushi and for

this great here is a Taoist Ocean which is 
the major of halibut that's what we're told

anyway halibut faded it and it's been torched 
a little bit with a little bit a little bit of

tobacco on top and you eat that with the ponzu 
sauce all right this is the Inca WA sushi oops

it literally melted in my mouth like it 
just kind of disappeared I think it's

very fatty a little bit of a smokiness from 
from the torching really quite good and not

something I can easily find in Vancouver 
so I'm super excited about this place
